name: Lotus 1-2-3 Spreadsheet
summary: Learn about .WKU files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Many businesses used Lotus 1-2-3 during the 1980s and 1990s for financial calculations, data tracking, and reporting. In these contexts, users created WKU files to organize information, perform calculations, and generate printed reports. As Lotus Software (later acquired by IBM) continued to develop Lotus 1-2-3, it released newer file formats, such as .WK1, .WK3 and .WK4, which replaced WKU, offering more features and improved compatibility.

instructions: You can open WKU files with Lotus 1-2-3. However, the software is discontinued. WKU files are a legacy format, which modern spreadsheet software does not support.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
